page.title: 03COMBE FARM
page.content: This farm comprises of 108 acres all down to grass, and supports a family of six. There is no rough grazing and all has been ploughed in the last ten years. There are herds of 70 cows,100 ewes (half pedigree Suffolk). Milk goes to the Torrington Dairy. Over the pas 25 years feeding has been all silage with no hay. Thewre are 2 acres of good oak and one acre of rough woodland. The land is heavy and has been drained within the last 15 years with a system installed to stop the flow of effluent into the river. Grass is grown with the aid of ammonium nitrate, two units per day during the growing season. It is totally self supporting for water with its three wells and gravity feed
